Tucson now recieves Notcorro's message.  He thinks of a way to signal him w=
ithout drawing attention to himself or the others.  It was critical.  He ke=
eps his weapons down, and sends an encrypted message back to Noctorro. 

" =
You're right, I'm not exactly perfect, and help would gladly be appreciated=
.  I have an idea.  While I have you on an encrypted signal, I best let you=
 know to start moving in now.  But try to remain unseen, move in gradually,=
 and quietly.  If you can, send in several fuzors in at a time, and in phas=
es, send in others, according to their skills and expertise.  I will contin=
ue to hold my position here."

Night Shift and Straight Shot keep quiet. Th=
ey could tell Tucson was in thought, and somehow thinking up a strategy to =
get them out of their bind.  He now had to send a message to Legacy.

"Lega=
cy, if you can hear me, I strongly suggest that you heed my demands and vac=
ate immediately. You are endangering the lives of Nightlight and the others=
, and those who endanger my comrades, deserve not to be among them.  Althou=
gh, I will be willing to meet with you privately in a remote location of yo=
ur choice.  But not now.  Now is not the time.  Heed my words now and thing=
s will not be difficult."

Back at the Ark, Uproar hears Rodimus, and trots=
 over to him, looking a bit confused.  Quickstride looks over to him as wel=
l.

" Sorry for the fuss, hey, what's go'n on?  Why won't the Ark open for =
us?"

Quickstride looks over to him.

"Legacy is holding the Ark hostage, I=
 think, or at least that's what I got from the last message from Lord Elder=
."

Uproar looks to the Ark and back at Rodimus.

"Whew, I'm glad you stopp=
ed me, Sir.  No tell'n what kind of attack I could've met up with.  Okay, I=
'm definitely in on helping you out.  But how are we gonna get the Ark back=
 without getting blown ta scrap?"  

Quickstride looks to Rodimus.

"Yeah, =
what he said, how are we gonna get outa this mess?  This is something neith=
er one of us has ever encountered." 



--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Supe=
r Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
> *Near to the Black Tower:*
> 
> A=
s Tuscon and the rest lay down their weapons, the other soldiers move to
> =
encircle the Maximals and the Autobots. Insecticon, Bruticus-X, and Iguanus=

> moved in almost eagerly to pick up the mighty weapons that Tuscon has
> =
dropped, while Inferno, the self proclaimed bodyguard of Hydras watched
> T=
uscon carefully, his optic ready to spot treachery.
> 
> Quietly a short me=
ssage is sent to Tuscon, "Tuscon." The deep voice of
> Noctorro, the leader=
 of the Maximal Fuzors can be heard, "My team is here.
> Rodimus sent us to=
 aid you. None too soon it would seem." Noctorro's words
> are grim, a sold=
ier's humor in them. "We await your signal."
> 
> At the same time Injector=
, Buzzclaw, Terrorgator, and Quickstrike move to do
> the same with Kup, Ni=
ghtshift, Straightshot, Talon and the others.
> Skyshadow, the leader of th=
e Predacon Fuzors just watches with a gloating
> look on his face, it is al=
most as if he wants them to attack and keep the
> battle going.
> 
> Meanwh=
ile Phobia and several sweeps keep an eye on things from the air,
> while T=
errorsaur and Waspinator landed, ready to help out as needed.
> 
> At the s=
ame time Legacy processed Tuscon's command for him to leave the Ark.
> Ther=
e was a long pause, and then the temporal guardian's cold voice comes
> acr=
oss the channel, "I will not comply with your command. I have been tasked
>=
 with the . . . >*BZZZTT!*<
> 
> Deepstryke transmits to Hydras, "Hydras. I=
 am picking up an encrypted
> transmissions to and from Tuscon, he is attem=
pting to communicate with the
> others. I am generating a radio dampening f=
ield now in this area. Only the
> Predacons will be able to transmit."
> 
>=
 
> *Meanwhile inside the Black Tower:*
> 
> Windlord's attempt to open fir=
e on the Scourge was met with a measure of
> futility. Scourge just stepped=
 away from the opening that Windlord fired out
> from and let the shots go =
harmlessly into a bulkhead, scorching it only
> slightly.
> 
> However that=
 slight amount of time allowed Windlord and Rat Trap time to
> scurry furth=
er into their crawl space and find an interior bulkhead to hide
> behind.
>=
 
> "Scrap!" Scourge's voice said from the outside. There was a pause and t=
hen,
> "Cyclonus, they have fled into the walls."
> 
> There was another pa=
use, and then Scourge chuckled, "Of course. I will be
> ready for them."
> =

> From further inside the crawl space the sounds of chittering could be he=
ard,
> and then several groups of optics could be seen in the distance comi=
ng
> towards Rat Trap and Windlord. In the darkness their shapes could only=
 be
> barely made out, but they looked like black metallic spiders, Hydras'=
 wall
> guardians!
> 
> (OOC: Rat Trap may recognize them from last time. A=
lso keep in mind that Rat
> Trap and Windlord should be in beast mode. They=
 would have to be to fit
> inside the crawl space. In the toon the Beast Mo=
des did not have offensive
> weaponry, except for teeth and claws)
> 
> *Ou=
tside the Ark:*
> 
> Rodimus was positioned in a small grove of trees, duck=
ing down behind
> several large rocks. He gives Quickstride a quizzical loo=
k as the equine
> Maximal sniffed him.
> 
> (OOC: Quickstride's sniff revea=
ls nothing wrong.)
> 
> He was about to let Quickstride in on what he had p=
lanned when Uproar
> appeared. Rodimus appears taken aback though by Uproar=
's conclusion that it
> was Legacy that had turned evil. While Rodimus didn=
't know that much about
> Legacy, having only seen him briefly while being =
rescued and repaired, there
> was nothing to hint that this attack was Lega=
cy's doing. He was about to say
> something when Uproar ran towards the Ark=
 to be let in . . .
> 
> >KRACK POW<
> 
> As Uproar ran towards the Ark, wh=
at seemed like a round bolt of lightening
> appeared, sending Uproar flying=
 several yards through the air, to land
> heavily on the ground! Evidently =
the Ark shielding was still in place, and
> it was not allowing anyone in.
=
> 
> Rodimus frowned, "Uproar! Get over here! If we are going to get back i=
n,
> then we need to work together. That shield is supposed to hold off all=
 the
> Predacon forces. We are not going to get in by brute force."
> 
> As=
 Rodimus talked three other Maximals seemed to almost materialize out of
> =
the underbrush, such was their skills at camouflage.
> 
> The first was Win=
g Caliber, (See: http://tfwiki.net/wiki/Skywarp ) an old
> Maximal stratagi=
st and military teacher, who from the brownish feathers
> along his frame t=
urned into some sort of eagle.
> 
> The next was Leo II, (
> http://en.acad=
emic.ru/pictures/enwiki/76/Lioconvoy_gathering.jpg ) the
> adopted son of L=
io Convoy, and who looked much like him, and who had
> obviously picked up =
many of his mannerisms. His body was powerfully built
> and heavily armored=
. He looked to turn into a lion.
> 
> The third was Ramulus (http://tfwiki.=
net/wiki/Ramulus) who had like the
> others been on patrol for a while, sur=
veying the area and trying to keep it
> free from Predacon invasion.
> 
> T=
hey also come up beside Rodimus, Leo II, obviously the leader of the other
=
> two, "What now sir?"
> 
> Rodimus looked at Quickstride and Uproar, "Well=
 let's get out of sight, and
> then we can discuss it."
> 
> *Meanwhile Ins=
ide the Ark:*
> 
> Perceptor had received Tuscon's message and sent attempt=
ed to send a message
> to Lord elder, however at the moment there was no an=
swer from the elder
> Maximal.
> 
> At the same time Legacy was still stand=
ing in the med lab along with the
> others, his single optic glowing in the=
 darkness.
> 
> "It would seem that Nightlight's vital systems are being he=
ld at minimal
> levels." Legacy said as he directed his gaze to the wall pa=
nel nearest
> Nightlight. A small light blinked, indicating her spark was s=
till online,
> but that there was not enough power to reboot her systems.
>=
 
> He turned to look at the others, his face glowing in the darkness, lit =
by
> his own optic, and the glowing bar on his chest plate. He raised his r=
ight
> hand in the air, the one with the arm cannon on it and begin to emit=
 light
> from it, much like a flash light or a beacon so that the room was
=
> illuminated. He casually looked around, "Perhaps we could locate a back o=
ut
> or reserve power system . . . "
> 
> Legacy paused as Tuscon's message=
 came in. He turned to look at Santon, Bump
> and Perceptor, a look of disb=
elief momentarily flashing across his face.
> 
> Legacy straightened as his=
 cold voice comes across the channel, "I will not
> comply with your comman=
d. I have been tasked with  . . . . >*BZZZTT!*<  . .
> . the protection of =
the Ark as well as that of the Matrix. I will not
> knowingly leave the Ark=
 undefended or the Matrix in the hands of another."
> 
> Legacy turned to l=
ook at his console as he understoodf what happened.
> Communications had be=
en cut part way through his message. He turned to look
> at the others, his=
 single optic cold, "It is illogical to believe that I
> would attempt to h=
arm the Ark or allow anyone to take it from the Maximals."
> 
> (TAG)
>

Preston
